content.description:
Sit start matched in a good 8 finger deep crack

 Use a high left foot to pull on, hit a left hand intermediate, go again with the left hand to a crimp pinch, rearrange feet to fight the right hand barndoor and top out straight up on good holds 

 Not the best fall zone, probably want a spotter to stop you from rolling down hill into talus
content.location: Center of the Western face, just right of Mezzanine

content.description:
Start with left hand on the low jug located in the arete, right hand at the same height on the small shelf below a cluster of unusable crimps. Crouch start to get your feet onto wall and work your way up the face of the boulder primarily using the arete with a few scattered crimps on the right side. Good feet all the way.

 Bail into the back side when you hit the last right hand crimp or top out the boulder by strattling it when it starts sloping inwards.
vertical boulder with 3 obvious lines and some good looking link ups, manageable landings
